definitions.Geometry.properties.coordina: Array of coordinate values in longitude, latitude format.
definitions.Geometry.properties.type.des: Indicator of the geometry represented in the GeoJSON Feature, for Echo will always be "Point".
definitions.ers0_MapData.properties.CWAs: Quarterly compliance status for the most recent 13 quarters. Each letter indicates the compliance status for the corresponding quarter.
definitions.ers0_MapData.properties.Form: The number of formal enforcement actions that have been taken against the facility
definitions.ers0_MapData.properties.ICON: Name of each individual icon file within the URL base
definitions.ers0_MapData.properties.Info: The number of informal enforcement actions that have been taken against the facility
The latitude of the facility in degrees, to four decimal places
The longitude of the facility in degrees, to four decimal places
definitions.ers0_MapData.properties.Last: The unique identifier for the last inspection
definitions.ers0_MapData.properties.NAME: For DFR, this is the Facility name. The name corresponds to the TYPE value
VIRGINIA CONCRETE ALEXANDRIA PLANT
Name
string
Pop up value. Combine with PopUpBaseURL to give the popup for the facility
definitions.ers0_MapData.properties.TYPE: For DFR, this is always facility
definitions.ers0_MapOutput.properties.Ic: URL where all the icons are located
definitions.ers0_MapOutput.properties.Po: Combine this URL with the PUC to get popup info
definitions.ers0_MapOutput.properties.Qu: Sequential number assigned to entire search result
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.C: The number of inspections/compliance evaluations under the Clean Air Act, occurring at the facility within the last five years
Indicates the number of enforcement actions taken against the facility within the last five years under the Clean Air Act.
Indicates the number of informal enforcement actions/notices of violations (NOVs) taken against the facility within the last five years under the Clean Air Act.
The total dollar amount of assessed (or final) penalties taken against the facility within the last five years under the Clean Air Act.

ICIS AIR Permit Types associated with the FRS Facility:
- Major
- Federally Reportable Minor
- Other Minor
- Synthetic Minor
- NULL
Clean Water Act Current Compliance Status
Indicates the number of enforcement actions taken against the facility within the last five years under the Clean Water Act.
Clean Water Act Formal Action Count
Indicates the number of informal enforcement actions/notices of violations (NOVs) taken against the facility within the last five years under the Clean Water Act.
Clean Water Act Informal Action Count
The number of inspections/compliance evaluations under the Clean Water Act, occurring at the facility within the last five years.
The total dollar amount of assessed (or final) penalties taken against the facility within the last five years under the Clean Water Act.

Indicates the facility's permit type or designation.
- Major
- Minor
Facility identifiers for the Clean Air Markets Division database.
A geographic unit used by the United States Census Bureau, generally defined to contain between 600 and 3,000 people.
Indicates if the facility has a current significant violation. 1 = Yes
Indicates if the facility has a current violation. 1 = Yes
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.E: Indicates if the facility has a formal enforcement action within the last 5 years. 1 = Yes
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.F: Facility in Chesapeake Bay Watershed Flag
The city where the facility is located.
The county where the facility is located.
Current compliance status: SNC/Serious Viol, In Violation, No Violation, Unknown, NULL. (Order corresponds to priority if multiple programs/permits exist)

The current Significant Non-compliance (SNC), Serious Violation or High Priority Violator (HPV) status for the facility during the most current quarter reflects the time the records were extracted from the program data systems
Indicates the effective date of the most recent listed enforcement action taken against the facility within the last five years.
The date of the most recent informal action or NOV taken recorded in AFS, ICIS-NPDES, RCRA Info or SDWIS.

The date on which most recent inspection of the facility took place. For the Clean Air Act, the date on which a Full Inspection (FCE) was completed. This date may or may not correspond to an actual site visit. A series of partial on- or off-site inspections may have been conducted during the fiscal year as part of this FCE.
Indicates the date on which the most recent assessed (or final) penalty was taken against the facility within the last five years
The number of days from the last ECHO refresh to the date on which the most recent inspection of the facility took place based on data recorded into AFS, ICIS-NPDES, or RCRA Info.
The 8-digit Hydrologic Unit Code (HUC) of the watershed in which the facility resides. A HUC number is assigned to every watershed in the nation and uniquely identifies the watershed.
The EPA region where the facility is located. EPA has 10 regional offices that execute programs within several states and territories
The 2-digit Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) code to identify the county that a facility is located in.

Indicates the total number of enforcement actions taken against the facility within the last five years. NA indicates that this measure is not applicable for facilities with no associated CAA, CWA, or RCRA permits
Flag showing Y/N whether the facility is located in Indian Country.
Indicates the total number of informal enforcement actions/notices of violations (NOVs) taken against the facility within the last five years

The number of inspections/compliance evaluations that have occurred at the facility, under the AIR, CWA, and RCRA, within the last five years. The last 5 years will include data from the 20 most recently completed quarters, plus data from the current quarter up until the refresh date. This count only includes inspection types that are counted as inspections in official counts.
Indicates the dollar amount of the most recent assessed (or final) penalty taken against the facility within the last five years

The latitude of the facility in decimal degrees expressed using the NAD83 horizontal datum. The coordinate comes from the FRS EPA Locational Reference Tables (LRT) file which represents the most accurate value for the facility based on the available spatial metadata.

The longitude of the facility in decimal degrees expressed using the NAD83 horizontal datum. The coordinate comes from the FRS EPA Locational Reference Tables (LRT) file which represents the most accurate value for the facility based on the available spatial metadata.
Graphical indicator denoting whether geographical data required to map a facility are available.
The default map icon image file calculated for the facility by the ECHO program.
W M A T A CENTRAL MAINT FAC
The total number of penalties assessed (or final) taken against the facility within the last five years
Percent Minority is the percentage of the population of the given area that is considered minority. Statistics are shown for the area within a 3-mile radius of each facility.

The number of persons per square mile in the area being profiled. This field is the ratio of total persons (displayed in the Total Persons field) to total land area (displayed in the Land Area field).
A count of the number of programs (AIR, CWA, SDWA, RCRA) related to the facility that have a current serious violation

Count of the number of quarters, out of the last twelve quarters, in which the permit or site is considered either in Non-compliance (NC), Significant Non-compliance (SNC) or High Priority violation (HPV) status

Street address where facility is located, as maintained by each data system. Certain data systems also maintain mailing address information, which is not used in this report. The street address may differ across EPA databases due to differences in reported information (e.g., use of mailing address), change in ownership, use of parent or subsidiary address, etc.
The total dollar amount of either assessed (or final) penalties taken against the facility within the last five years
A Y/N flag indicating that the facility is within 100KM of the US-Mexico Border.
All Case Numbers of Federal Enforcement Cases relating to the Facility from the ICIS System
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.G: The sum of total release amounts of all linked Greenhouse Gas IDs reported as "metric tons of CO2 equivalents"
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.I: Indicates if the facility has an informal enforcement action within the last 5 years. 1 = Yes.
Indicates if the facility has an inspection within the last 5 years. 1 = Yes
Inspected Within Last Five Years Flag
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.L: Flag showing Y/N whether location is within the contiguous (lower 48) United States.
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.M: The maximum percentile from all individual EJSCREEN indicators.
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.N: Clean Water Act ID from the ICIS-NPDES (Integrated Compliance Information System - National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System)
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.P: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN NATA air toxics cancer risk indicator.
string
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN diesel particulate matter indicator.
string
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN ozone indicator.
string
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN Lead paint indicator.
string
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN particulate matter indicator.
string
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN proximity to major direct water dischargers indicator.
string
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN proximity to National Priorities List (NPL) sites indicator.
string
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN proximity to Risk Management Plan (RMP) sites indicator.
string
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN proximity to Treatment Storage and Disposal Facilities (TSDFs) indicator.
string
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN NATA respiratory hazard index indicator.
string
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN Traffic proximity and volume indicator.
string
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.R: Indicates the number of enforcement actions taken against the facility within the last five years under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act.
A unique 12-character ID assigned for each record/permit/site/facility within the RCRAInfo database.
Resource Conservation and Recovery Act IDs
Indicates the number of informal enforcement actions/notices of violations (NOVs) taken against the facility within the last five years under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act.
The number of inspections/compliance evaluations under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act, occurring at the facility within the last five years
Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Inspection Count

RCRA Facility Types include:
- TSDF = Treatment, Storage and Disposal facility
- LQG = Large Quantity Generator
- SQG = Small Quantity Generator
- CESQG = Conditionally-Exempt Small Quantity Generator
- Operating TSDF
- Transporters
Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Permit Types
An internal 12-digit Facility Registry Service (FRS) tracking number used to tie all facility data together in EPA regulatory program databases.
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.S: Indicates the number of enforcement actions taken against the facility within the last five years under the Safe Drinking Water Act
A unique 9-character ID assigned for each public water system within the Safe Drinking Water Information System (SDWIS).
Indicates the number of informal enforcement actions/notices of violations (NOVs) taken against the facility within the last five years under the Safe Drinking Water Act
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.T: A unique 15-character ID assigned for each facility within the Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) program. The format is ZZZZZNNNNNSSSSS, where ZZZZZ = ZIP code, NNNNN = the first 5 consonants of the name, and SSSSS = the first 5 non-blank non-special characters in the street address.
Toxics Release Inventory Offsite Transfer Count
Total chemical releases, in pounds, as reported to the Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) by the facility for the most recent reporting year
Toxics Release Inventory Reporter In Past Flag
Flag indicating whether or not a facility has a TSCA ID
Toxic Substances Control Act ID assigned to a facility
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.V: Indicates if the facility had a violation within the last 3 years. 1 = Yes
definitions.ers1_Facilities.properties.W: Contains flags that identify what web accessible documents are available for the facility.
definitions.ers1_Results.properties.CVRo: Summary count of the number of CWA facilities or SDWA public drinking water systems with current violations.
definitions.ers1_Results.properties.FEAR: Summary count of the number of facilities with a formal enforcement action in the past five years
definitions.ers1_Results.properties.INSP: Number of facilities with insp_5yr_flag populated (CWP_DATE_LAST_INSPECTION)
definitions.ers1_Results.properties.Indi: Number of facilities with tribal_flag populated
definitions.ers1_Results.properties.InfF: Number of facilities with infea_5yr_flag populated (INFORMAL_ENF_ACT_COUNT > 0)
definitions.ers1_Results.properties.Mess: Field to record messages (typically performance-related) about packet processing
definitions.ers1_Results.properties.Page: The number of pages of results returned
definitions.ers1_Results.properties.Quer: Sequential number assigned to entire search result
definitions.ers1_Results.properties.SVRo: Number of facilities with curr_sv_flag populated (CWP_STATUS = "Significant Violation")
definitions.ers1_Results.properties.Tota: The total dollar amount of either assessed or final penalties within the five year time period
definitions.ers1_Results.properties.V3Ro: Number of facilities having one or more quarters in non-compliance (QNC) in the last three years
definitions.ers1_Results.properties.Vers: Version of the SDWA system service
Summary count of the number of CWA facilities or SDWA public drinking water systems with current violations.
The latitude in decimal degrees expressed using the NAD83 horizontal datum.
The longitude in decimal degrees expressed using the NAD83 horizontal datum.
The EPA region where the facility is located. EPA has 10 regional offices that execute programs within several states and territories
Summary count of the number of facilities with a formal enforcement action in the past five years
Number of facilities with insp_5yr_flag populated (CWP_DATE_LAST_INSPECTION)
Number of facilities with tribal_flag populated
Number of facilities with infea_5yr_flag populated (INFORMAL_ENF_ACT_COUNT > 0)
Sequential number assigned to each facility returned

The total dollar amount of either assessed or final penalties within the five year time period
Number of facilities having one or more quarters in non-compliance (QNC) in the last three years

A Y/N flag indicating that the facility is within 100KM of the US-Mexico Border.
All Case Numbers of Federal Enforcement Cases relating to the Facility from the ICIS System
definitions.ers5_properties.properties.G: The sum of total release amounts of all linked Greenhouse Gas IDs reported as "metric tons of CO2 equivalents"
definitions.ers5_properties.properties.I: Indicates if the facility has an informal enforcement action within the last 5 years. 1 = Yes.
Indicates if the facility has an inspection within the last 5 years. 1 = Yes
Inspected Within Last Five Years Flag
definitions.ers5_properties.properties.L: Flag showing Y/N whether location is within the contiguous (lower 48) United States.
definitions.ers5_properties.properties.M: The maximum percentile from all individual EJSCREEN indicators.
definitions.ers5_properties.properties.N: Clean Water Act ID from the ICIS-NPDES (Integrated Compliance Information System - National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System)
definitions.ers5_properties.properties.P: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN NATA air toxics cancer risk indicator.
number
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN diesel particulate matter indicator.
number
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN ozone indicator.
number
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN Lead paint indicator.
number
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN particulate matter indicator.
number
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN proximity to major direct water dischargers indicator.
number
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN proximity to National Priorities List (NPL) sites indicator.
number
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN proximity to Risk Management Plan (RMP) sites indicator.
number
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN proximity to Treatment Storage and Disposal Facilities (TSDFs) indicator.
number
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN NATA respiratory hazard index indicator.
number
The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN Traffic proximity and volume indicator.
number
definitions.ers5_properties.properties.R: Indicates the number of enforcement actions taken against the facility within the last five years under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act.
A unique 12-character ID assigned for each record/permit/site/facility within the RCRAInfo database.
Resource Conservation and Recovery Act IDs
Indicates the number of informal enforcement actions/notices of violations (NOVs) taken against the facility within the last five years under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act.
The number of inspections/compliance evaluations under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act, occurring at the facility within the last five years
Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Inspection Count

RCRA Facility Types include:
- TSDF = Treatment, Storage and Disposal facility
- LQG = Large Quantity Generator
- SQG = Small Quantity Generator
- CESQG = Conditionally-Exempt Small Quantity Generator
- Operating TSDF
- Transporters
Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Permit Types
An internal 12-digit Facility Registry Service (FRS) tracking number used to tie all facility data together in EPA regulatory program databases.
definitions.ers5_properties.properties.S: Indicates the number of enforcement actions taken against the facility within the last five years under the Safe Drinking Water Act
A unique 9-character ID assigned for each public water system within the Safe Drinking Water Information System (SDWIS).
Indicates the number of informal enforcement actions/notices of violations (NOVs) taken against the facility within the last five years under the Safe Drinking Water Act
definitions.ers5_properties.properties.T: A unique 15-character ID assigned for each facility within the Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) program. The format is ZZZZZNNNNNSSSSS, where ZZZZZ = ZIP code, NNNNN = the first 5 consonants of the name, and SSSSS = the first 5 non-blank non-special characters in the street address.
Toxics Release Inventory Offsite Transfer Count
Total chemical releases, in pounds, as reported to the Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) by the facility for the most recent reporting year
Toxics Release Inventory Reporter In Past Flag
Flag indicating whether or not a facility has a TSCA ID
Toxic Substances Control Act ID assigned to a facility
definitions.ers5_properties.properties.V: Indicates if the facility had a violation within the last 3 years. 1 = Yes
definitions.ers5_properties.properties.W: Contains flags that identify what web accessible documents are available for the facility.
definitions.met_Results.properties.Messa: Field to record messages (typically performance-related) about packet processing
definitions.met_ResultsColumns.propertie: Data length for EPA program database column.
Data type for EPA program database column.
A description of the category of Supplemental Environment Project (SEP) for a settlement.
info.contact.name: US EPA, OECA Integration, Targeting and Access Branch
info.description:
Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO) is a tool developed and maintained by EPA's Office of Enforcement and Compliance Assurance for public use. ECHO provides integrated compliance and enforcement information for about 800,000 regulated facilities nationwide.

ECHO Rest Services provide multiple service endpoints, each with specific capabilities, to search and retrieve data on facilities regulated as Clean Air Act (CAA) stationary sources, Clean Water Act (CWA) dischargers, Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) hazardous waste generators/handlers, and Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA) public water systems. Data of interest from other EPA sources, such as the Toxics Release Inventory, is also supplied for context.

The get_facilities, get_map, get_qid, and get_download end points are meant to be used together, while the enhanced get_facility_info end point is self contained. The get_facility_info end point returns either an array of state, county or zip clusters with summary statistics per cluster or an array of facilities.

The recommended use scenario for get_facilities, get_qid, get_map, and get_downoad is:

1) Use get_facilities to validate passed query parameters, obtain summary statistics and to obtain a query_id (QID). QIDs are time sensitive and will be valid for approximately 30 minutes.
2) Use get_qid, with the returned QID, to paginate through arrays of facility results.
3) Use get_map, with the returned QID, to zoom in/out and pan on the clustered and individual facility coordinates that meet the QID query criteria.
4) Use get_download, with the returned QID, to generate a Comma Separated Value (CSV) file of facility information that meets the QID query criteria.

Use the qcolumns parameter to customize your search results. Use the Metdata service endpoint for a list of available output objects, their Column Ids, and their definitions to help you build your customized output.

Additional ECHO Resources: Web Services, About ECHO's Data, Data Downloads
info.license.name: This page was built with the Swagger API.
info.title: U.S. EPA Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO) - All Data
parameters.c1_lat.description: Latitude of 1st corner of box that bounds the resulting facilities. The latitude and longitude of both corners of the bounding box must be provided.
parameters.c1_lat.name: c1_lat
parameters.c1_long.description: Longitude of 1st corner of box that bounds the resulting facilities. The latitude and longitude of both corners of the bounding box must be provided.
parameters.c1_long.name: c1_long
parameters.c2_lat.description: Latitude of 2nd corner of box that bounds the resulting facilities. The latitude and longitude of both corners of the bounding box must be provided.
parameters.c2_lat.name: c2_lat
parameters.c2_long.description: Longitude of 2nd corner of box that bounds the resulting facilities. The latitude and longitude of both corners of the bounding box must be provided.
parameters.c2_long.name: c2_long
parameters.callback.description: JSONP Callback.  For use with JSONP and GEOJSONP output only.  Enter a name of the function in which to wrap the JSON response.
parameters.callback.name: callback
parameters.descending.description: Output Sort Column Descending Flag.  Enter Y to column identified in the newsort parameter descending.  Enter N to use ascending sort order. Used only when newsort parameter is populated.
parameters.descending.name: descending
parameters.maplist.description: Map List Flag.  Provide a Y to return mappable coordinates representing the full geographic extent of the queryset (all facilities that met the selection criteria).
parameters.maplist.name: maplist
parameters.newsort.description: Output Sort Column.  Enter the number of the column on which the data will be sorted. If unpopulated results will sort on the first column.
parameters.newsort.name: newsort
parameters.p_act.description: Active Permits/Facilities Flag.  Provide Y or N to filter results to facilities with active permits.
parameters.p_act.name: p_act
parameters.p_c1lat.description: In decimal degrees.  Latitude of 1st corner of box that bounds the resulting facilities. The latitude and longitude of both corners of the bounding box must be provided.
parameters.p_c1lat.name: p_c1lat
parameters.p_c1lon.description: In decimal degrees.  Longitude of 1st corner of box that bounds the resulting facilities. The latitude and longitude of both corners of the bounding box must be provided.
parameters.p_c1lon.name: p_c1lon
parameters.p_c2lat.description: In decimal degrees.  Latitude of 2nd corner of box that bounds the resulting facilities. The latitude and longitude of both corners of the bounding box must be provided.
parameters.p_c2lat.name: p_c2lat
parameters.p_c2lon.description: In decimal degrees.  Longitude of 2nd corner of box that bounds the resulting facilities. The latitude and longitude of both corners of the bounding box must be provided.
parameters.p_c2lon.name: p_c2lon
parameters.p_co.description: Facility County Filter. Provide a single county name in combination with a state value provided via p_st.
parameters.p_co.name: p_co
parameters.p_cs.description:
Facility Compliance Limiter.  Enter 2, 3 or 4 to limit facilities returned.
- 2 = Facilities in noncompliance.
- 3 = Facilities having one or more programs reporting significant noncompliance.
- 4 = Facilities having more than one program reporting significant noncompliance.
parameters.p_cs.name: p_cs
parameters.p_ct.description: Facility City Filter. Enter a single case-insensitive city name to filter results.
parameters.p_ct.name: p_ct
parameters.p_ejscreen.description: Enter "Y" to limit facilities to Census block groups where one of more Environmental Justice indexes above 80th percentile.
parameters.p_ejscreen.name: p_ejscreen
parameters.p_ejscreen_over80cnt.name: p_ejscreen_over80cnt
parameters.p_fa.description: Federal Agency. 1 character or 5-character values; may contain multiple comma-separated values. ALL will retrieve all facilities where the federal agency code is not null.  Use the Federal Agencies lookup service to obtain a list of values.
parameters.p_fa.name: p_fa
parameters.p_fac_icos.description: FRS tribal land spatial flag.  Enter "Y" or "N" to include or exclude facilities based on FRS tribal land spatial flag.
parameters.p_fac_icos.name: p_fac_icos
parameters.p_fea.description:
Formal Enforcement Actions [within / not within] specified date range indicator. The date range is determined by parameters p_fead1 and p_fead2 or by parameter p_feay.
- W = within date range
- N = not within date range
parameters.p_fea.name: p_fea
parameters.p_feaa.description:
Agency associated with Formal Enforcement Actions:
- E = EPA
- S = State
- A = All
parameters.p_feaa.name: p_feaa
parameters.p_feac.description: Formal Enforcment Action Last Case Date Limiter Flag.  Enter a value of "Y" to additionally apply the p_feay year filter to the last formal enforcement action case date.  Use the p_fea parameter to control if the filter is within or outside the date span provided.
parameters.p_feac.name: p_feac
parameters.p_feay.description: Years (1 to 5) Range.  This value is used to create a date range for Formal Enforcement Actions (FEA). Used along with p_fea (which indicates whether to look within or outside of the date range) to find FEAs within (or not within) the number of years specified.
parameters.p_feay.name: p_feay
parameters.p_ff.description: Federal Facility Indicator Flag. Enter Y to restrict searches to federal facilities.
parameters.p_ff.name: p_ff
parameters.p_fips.description: FIPS Code Filter.  Enter a single 5-character Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) state + county value to restrict results.  E.g. to limit results to Kenosha County, Wisconsin, use 55059.
parameters.p_fips.name: p_fips
parameters.p_fn.description: Facility Name Filter. Enter one or more case-insensitive facility names to filter results.  Provide multiple values as a comma-delimited list.  See p_fntype for additional modifiers.
parameters.p_fn.name: p_fn
parameters.p_fntype.description:
Controls type of text search performed on facility name with parameter p_fn.
- EXACT = Find facilities having the exact provided name(s).
- BEGINS = Find facilities with names starting with the provided term(s).
- ALL = Find facilities using Oracle text search terms.
- CONTAINS =
parameters.p_fntype.name: p_fntype
parameters.p_frs.description: Facility Registry Service ID Filter. Enter a single 12-digit FRS identifier to filter results.
parameters.p_frs.name: p_frs
parameters.p_huc.description: 2-, 4-, 6-, or 8-character watershed. May contain multiple comma-separated values.
parameters.p_huc.name: p_huc
parameters.p_ico.description: Indian Country Flag.  Enter a "Y" or "N" to restrict searches to facilities inside or outside Indian Country.
parameters.p_ico.name: p_ico
parameters.p_icoo.description: Indian country search and/or flag.  Enter "Y" to set indian country search conditions to return any results found using p_ico, p_fac_ico or p_fac_icoo.  Otherwise only results matching all provided p_ico, p_fac_ico or p_fac_icoo conditions will be returned.
parameters.p_icoo.name: p_icoo
parameters.p_id.name: p_id
parameters.p_iea.description:
Informal Enforcement Actions [within / not within] specified date range.  The date range is determined by parameters p_iead1 and p_iead2 or by parameter p_ieay.
- W = within date range
- N = not within date range
parameters.p_iea.name: p_iea
parameters.p_ieaa.description:
Agency associated with Informal Enforcement Actions. If left blank, both agencies are included.
- E = EPA
- S = State
parameters.p_ieaa.name: p_ieaa
parameters.p_ieay.description: Years (1 to 5) Range.  This value is used to create a date range for Informal Enforcement Actions (IEA). Used along with p_iea (which indicates whether to look within or outside of the date range) to find IEAs within (or not within) the number of years specified.
parameters.p_ieay.name: p_ieay
parameters.p_impw.description: Discharging into Impaired Waters Flag. Enter Y to limit results to facilities with discharge to waterbodies listed as impaired in the ATTAINS database.
parameters.p_impw.name: p_impw
parameters.p_lat.name: p_lat
parameters.p_limit_addr.description: Limit Address Search Flag.  Enter Y to restrict facility searches to native data source only.
parameters.p_limit_addr.name: p_limit_addr
parameters.p_long.name: p_long
parameters.p_mact.description: CAA Maximum Achievable Control Technology (MACT) Subpart codes (alpha ID between 1 and 7 characters) applicable to the facility.
parameters.p_mact.name: p_mact
parameters.p_maj.description: Major Facility Flag.  Enter Y to restrict results to Major facilities only.
parameters.p_maj.name: p_maj
parameters.p_med.description: Filter Results by Media.- A = Air- C = CAMD (Clean Air Markets Division)- E = EIS (Emissions Inventory Systems)- G = GHG (Greenhouse Gases)- M = RMP (Risk Management Plan)- R = RCRA (Hazardous Waste)- S = SDWA (Public Drinking Water Systems)- T = TRI (Toxic Release Inventory)- TSCA = TSCA (Toxic Substances Control Act)- W = Water- ALL = Air and Water and RCRA
parameters.p_med.name: p_med
parameters.p_naa.description: Non-Attainment Area Flag.  Enter a Y or N to filter for or against facilities flagged as non-attainment areas.
parameters.p_naa.name: p_naa
parameters.p_ncs.description: North American Industry Classification System Filter. Enter two to six digits to filter results to facilities having matching NAICS codes.  Digits less than six will match to all codes beginning with the provided values.
parameters.p_ncs.name: p_ncs
parameters.p_ocr.description:
Toxics Release Inventory Pounds of On-Site Chemical Releases Limiter.  Enter a keyword to filter results.
- Z = Zero pounds of chemical releases.
- GT0 = More than zero pounds of chemical releases.
- GT1000 = More than one thousand pounds of chemical releases.
- GT5000 = More than five thousand pounds of chemical releases.
- GT10000 = More than ten thousand pounds of chemical releases.
- GT20000 = More than twenty thousand pounds of chemical releases.
- GT50000 = More than fifty thousand pounds of chemical releases.
parameters.p_ocr.name: p_ocr
parameters.p_oct.description:
Toxic Release Inventory Pounds of Off-Site Chemical Releases Limiter.  Enter a keyword to filter results.
- Z = Zero pounds of chemical releases.
- GT0 = More than zero pounds of chemical releases.
- GT1000 = More than one thousand pounds of chemical releases.
- GT5000 = More than five thousand pounds of chemical releases.
- GT10000 = More than ten thousand pounds of chemical releases.
- GT20000 = More than twenty thousand pounds of chemical releases.
- GT50000 = More than fifty thousand pounds of chemical releases.
parameters.p_oct.name: p_oct
parameters.p_pd.description:
Population Density Limiter (per sq mile). Enter a value to limit results to facilities located in area of a given population density.
- NONE = 0 population density per square mile
- GT100 = More than 100 population density per square mile
- GT500 = More than 500 population density per square mile
- GT1000 = More than 1000 population density per square mile
- GT5000 = More than 5000 population density per square mile
- GT10000 = More than 10000 population density per square mile
- GT20000 = More than 20000 population density per square mile
parameters.p_pd.name: p_pd
parameters.p_pen.description:
Last Penality Date Qualifier Filter.  Enter one of the following:   
- NEVER = No Penalties
- ANY = Any Penalty
- LEXX = Less than or equal to XX months.  Provide a number in place of XX, e.g. "LE5" for a facility with a penalty within previous 5 months.
- GTXX = Greater than XX months.  Provide a number in place of XX, eg. GT12, for a facility with the last penalty greater than 12 months ago.
parameters.p_pen.name: p_pen
parameters.p_pid.description: Nine-digit permit IDs. May contain up to 2000 comma-separated values.
parameters.p_pid.name: p_pid
parameters.p_pm.description:
Percent Minority Population Limiter.  Enter a value to restrict results to facilities with a given percentage of minority population within 3-mile radius.
- NONE = 0%
- GT5 = greater than 5%
- GT10 = greater than 10%
- GT25 = greater than 25%
- GT50 = greater than 50%
- GT75 = greater than 75%
parameters.p_pm.name: p_pm
parameters.p_pretty_print.description: Optional flag to request GeoJSON formatted results to be pretty printed.  Only provide a numeric value when the output needs to be human readable as pretty printing has a performance cost.
parameters.p_pretty_print.name: p_pretty_print
parameters.p_qid.description: Query ID Selector.  Enter the QueryID number from a previously run query.
parameters.p_qid.name: p_qid
parameters.p_qiv.description:
Quarters in Noncompliance Limiter.  Enter a coded value to limit results to facilities with given quarter of noncompliance.
- Z = Zero quarters in noncompliance.
- GEXX = Replacing XX with a numeric value, that number of quarterd or more in noncompliance.
- GTXX = Replacing XX with a numeric value, more than that number of quarters in noncompliance.
parameters.p_qiv.name: p_qiv
parameters.p_qs.description: Quick Search. Allows entry for city, state, and/or zip code.
parameters.p_qs.name: p_qs
parameters.p_radius.description: Spatial Search Radius.  Enter a radius up to 100 miles in which to spatially search for facilities.
parameters.p_radius.name: p_radius
parameters.p_reg.description: EPA Region Filter. Provide a single value of 01 thru 10 to restrict results to a single EPA region.
parameters.p_reg.name: p_reg
parameters.p_sa.description: Facility street address. Enter a complete or partial street address.
parameters.p_sa.name: p_sa
parameters.p_sa1.description: Facility street address. Enter a complete or partial street address.   Note that p_sa1 is culmulative with p_sa.
parameters.p_sa1.name: p_sa1
parameters.p_sfs.description: Single Facility Search Filter.  Provide a facility name or program system identifier to limit results.  For the all data search, the FRS registry identifier is also searched.
parameters.p_sfs.name: p_sfs
parameters.p_sic.description: Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) Code Filter.  Enter a single 4-digit SIC Code to filter results.  If more complex filtering is required, use p_sic2 and p_sic4.
parameters.p_sic.name: p_sic
parameters.p_sic2.description: Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) Code Filter Alternate 2. Enter a wild-card search against SIC codes.  A final wild-card is always present allowing "22" to match all SIC codes beginning with 22.  Use the "%" character within strings to match any SIC values with the pattern.  For example, "2%21" matches 2021, 2121, 2221, etc.
parameters.p_sic2.name: p_sic2
parameters.p_sic4.description: Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) Code Filter Alternate 3.  Enter the first 2, 3 or 4 SIC code digits to filter results to facilities having those code prefixes.  As this alternative does not utilize an index, p_sic2 will generally be quicker.
parameters.p_sic4.name: p_sic4
parameters.p_sid.description: System Identifier.  The unique facility identifer for the EPA system.  Examples:  For ICIS NPDES the 9 digit NPDES Id.
parameters.p_sid.name: p_sid
parameters.p_st.description: Facility State and State-Equivalent Filter.  Provide one or more USPS postal abbreviations for states and state-equivalents to filter results.  Provide multiple values as a comma-delimited list.
parameters.p_st.name: p_st
parameters.p_trep.description:
Current Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) Reporter Limiter.  Enter one of the following codes to limit results.
- NONE = Never has reported to TRI.
- CURR = Current TRI reporter.
- NONCURR = Has reported to TRI in the past but not for the current reporting year.
parameters.p_trep.name: p_trep
parameters.p_tribedist.description: Proximity to tribal land limiter. Enter an amount of mile between 0 and 25 to filter results.  This parameter is only evaluated if p_tribeid is populated.
parameters.p_tribedist.name: p_tribedist
parameters.p_tribeid.description: Numeric code for tribe (or list of tribes).
parameters.p_tribeid.name: p_tribeid
parameters.p_tribename.description: Tribe Name Filter.  Enter a single tribe name to filter results.
parameters.p_tribename.name: p_tribename
parameters.p_usmex.description: US-Mexico Border Flag.  Enter Y/N to restrict searches to facilities located within 100KM of the border.
parameters.p_usmex.name: p_usmex
parameters.p_wbd.description: 2-, 4-, 6-, or 8-character watershed (WBD from the USGS Watershed Boundary Dataset). May contain multiple comma-separated values.
parameters.p_wbd.name: p_wbd
parameters.p_ysl.description:
Last Facility Inspection [within / not within] Specified Date Range Indicator. The date range is determined by parameters p_idt1 and p_idt2 or by parameter p_ysly.
- W = within date range
- N = not within date range
parameters.p_ysl.name: p_ysl
parameters.p_ysla.description:
Facility Last Inspection Code Filter.  If left blank, both agencies are included.  Enter a value to limit results:
- E = EPA
- S = State
parameters.p_ysla.name: p_ysla
parameters.p_ysly.description: Number of years (1 to 5) since last facility inspection.  A value of 1 means that it has been inspected within the year.
parameters.p_ysly.name: p_ysly
parameters.p_zip.description: 5-Digit ZIP Code Filter. Provide one or more 5-digit postal zip codes to filter results.  May contain multiple comma-separated values.
parameters.p_zip.name: p_zip
parameters.pageno.description: Indicates the number of the page to display. It is used only when the results are paginated.
parameters.pageno.name: pageno
parameters.qid.description: Query ID Selector.  Enter the QueryID number from a previously run query.
parameters.qid.name: qid
parameters.queryset.description: Query Limiter.  Enter a value to limit the number of records returned for each query. Value cannot exceed 70,000.
parameters.queryset.name: queryset
parameters.responseset.description: Response Set Limiter. Enter a value to limit the number of records per page. Value cannot exceed 1,000.
parameters.responseset.name: responseset
parameters.summarylist.description: Summary List Flag.  Enter a Y to return a list of summary statistics based on the parameters submitted to the query service.
parameters.summarylist.name: summarylist
parameters.tablelist.description: Table List Flag. Enter a Y to display the first page of facility results.
parameters.tablelist.name: tablelist
parameters.xmax.description: Maximum longitude value in decimal degrees.
parameters.xmax.name: xmax
parameters.xmin.description: Minimum longitude value in decimal degrees.
parameters.xmin.name: xmin
parameters.ymax.description: Maximum latitude value in decimal degrees.
parameters.ymax.name: ymax
parameters.ymin.description: Minimum latitude value in decimal degrees.
parameters.ymin.name: ymin
paths./echo_rest_services.get_download.g: Based on the QID obtained from a get_facilities or get_facility_info query, return a comma separated value (CSV) file of the facilities found.

Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- CSV = Facility results formatted as comma delimited file download (default).
- GEOJSOND = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection download.

Used to cutomize service output.  A list of comma-separated column IDs of output objects that will be returned in the service query object or download.  Use the metadata service endpoint for a complete list of Ids and definitions.
Results are a comma separated value (CSV) file or a file containing a GeoJSON feature collection.
paths./echo_rest_services.get_download.p: Based on the QID obtained from a get_facilities or get_facility_info query, return a comma separated value (CSV) file of the facilities found.

Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- CSV = Facility results formatted as comma delimited file download (default).
- GEOJSOND = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection download.

Used to cutomize service output.  A list of comma-separated column IDs of output objects that will be returned in the service query object or download.  Use the metadata service endpoint for a complete list of Ids and definitions.
Results are a comma separated value (CSV) file or a file containing a GeoJSON feature collection.
paths./echo_rest_services.get_facilities: Validates query search parameters and returns query identifier.  Use the responseset parameter to set the page size

Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- JSON = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation (default).
- JSONP = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation with Padding.  
- XML = Data model formatted as Extensible Markup Language.

Used to cutomize service output.  A list of comma-separated column IDs of output objects that will be returned in the service query object or download.  Use the metadata service endpoint for a complete list of Ids and definitions.
Results are summary statistics for the query and a query identifier (QID).
Validates query search parameters and returns query identifier.  Use the responseset parameter to set the page size

Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- JSON = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation (default).
- JSONP = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation with Padding.  
- XML = Data model formatted as Extensible Markup Language.

Used to cutomize service output.  A list of comma-separated column IDs of output objects that will be returned in the service query object or download.  Use the metadata service endpoint for a complete list of Ids and definitions.
Results are summary statistics for the query and a query identifier (QID).
paths./echo_rest_services.get_facility_i: Returns either an array of Facilities or an array of Clusters that meet the specified search criteria.

Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- JSON = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation (default).
- JSONP = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation with Padding.  
- XML = Data model formatted as Extensible Markup Language.
- CSV = Facility results formatted as comma delimited file download.
- GEOJSON = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection.
- GEOJSONP = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection with Padding.
- GEOJSOND = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection download.

Used to cutomize service output.  A list of comma-separated column IDs of output objects that will be returned in the service query object or download.  Use the metadata service endpoint for a complete list of Ids and definitions.

Results will either be an array of Facilities or an array of Clusters. The determination as to whether Facilities or Clusters are returned is based on the number of facilities that meet the specified criteria. Generally, if there are more than ~2000 facilities, the search will return clusters; otherwise individual facility records will be returned.
Combined ECHO Facility Enhanced Search Service
Returns either an array of Facilities or an array of Clusters that meet the specified search criteria.

Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- JSON = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation (default).
- JSONP = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation with Padding.  
- XML = Data model formatted as Extensible Markup Language.
- CSV = Facility results formatted as comma delimited file download.
- GEOJSON = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection.
- GEOJSONP = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection with Padding.
- GEOJSOND = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection download.

Used to cutomize service output.  A list of comma-separated column IDs of output objects that will be returned in the service query object or download.  Use the metadata service endpoint for a complete list of Ids and definitions.

Results will either be an array of Facilities or an array of Clusters. The determination as to whether Facilities or Clusters are returned is based on the number of facilities that meet the specified criteria. Generally, if there are more than ~2000 facilities, the search will return clusters; otherwise individual facility records will be returned.
Combined ECHO Facility Enhanced Search Service
paths./echo_rest_services.get_geojson.ge: Based on the QID obtained from a get_facilities or get_facility_info query, return GeoJSON of the facilities found.

Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- GEOJSON = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection (default).
- GEOJSONP = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection with Padding.
- GEOJSOND = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection download.

Used to cutomize service output.  A list of comma-separated column IDs of output objects that will be returned in the service query object or download.  Use the metadata service endpoint for a complete list of Ids and definitions.
Results are formatted as a GeoJSON feature collection.
Static marker indicating object is a GeoJSON Feature Collection.

paths./echo_rest_services.get_info_clust: Based on the QID obtained from a clustered get_facility_info query, download cluster facility information as either a CSV or GEOJSON file.

Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- CSV = Facility results formatted as comma delimited file download (default).
- GEOJSOND = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection download.
Results are a comma separated value (CSV) file or a file containing a GeoJSON feature collection.
Based on the QID obtained from a clustered get_facility_info query, download cluster facility information as either a CSV or GEOJSON file.

Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- CSV = Facility results formatted as comma delimited file download (default).
- GEOJSOND = Facility results formatted as GeoJSON feature collection download.
Results are a comma separated value (CSV) file or a file containing a GeoJSON feature collection.
paths./echo_rest_services.get_map.get.de: The purpose of the GET_MAP service is to display facility coordinates and facility clusters related to a get_facilities facility query. Currently, the maximum number of coordinates returned is 500. GET_MAP performs automatic clustering at the state, county, and zip code levels to maximize the number of coordinates returned.
paths./echo_rest_services.get_map.get.pa:
Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- JSON = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation (default).
- JSONP = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation with Padding.  
- XML = Data model formatted as Extensible Markup Language.
paths./echo_rest_services.get_map.get.re: Results are either an array of State, County, Zip Code facility cluster map coordinates or individual facility coordinates.  Coordinates provided are in WGS84.
paths./echo_rest_services.get_map.post.d: The purpose of the GET_MAP service is to display facility coordinates and facility clusters related to a get_facilities facility query. Currently, the maximum number of coordinates returned is 500. GET_MAP performs automatic clustering at the state, county, and zip code levels to maximize the number of coordinates returned.

paths./echo_rest_services.get_qid.get.de: GET_QID is passed with a query ID corresponding to a previously run get_facilities query. It then returns a Facility object containing all matching facilities. The main purpose of GET_QID is for large querysets that contain multiple pages (responsesets) of output. GET_QID allows for pagination and for the selection and sorting of columns.
paths./echo_rest_services.get_qid.get.pa:
Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- JSON = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation (default).
- JSONP = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation with Padding.  
- XML = Data model formatted as Extensible Markup Language.

Used to cutomize service output.  A list of comma-separated column IDs of output objects that will be returned in the service query object or download.  Use the metadata service endpoint for a complete list of Ids and definitions.
paths./echo_rest_services.get_qid.get.re: Results are an array (page) Facility Registry System (FRS)  Facilities with the number of facilities equal to the responseset (page size).
paths./echo_rest_services.get_qid.post.d: GET_QID is passed with a query ID corresponding to a previously run get_facilities query. GET_QID allows for pagination and for the selection and sorting of columns.
